intro: Endotropis alnifolia, commonly known as the alderleaf maple, is a deciduous tree native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the family Sapindaceae and is characterized by its alternate, simple, and ovate leaves with serrated margins. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers in catkins, followed by winged samaras as its fruit. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in riparian zones and along stream banks. Its botanical features make it an important species for ecological studies and landscape horticulture.
